intro: Echites varius var. sulphureus, commonly known as the sulphur-flowered echites, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble small sunflowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual with hairy stems and palmate leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a source of natural dyes.
